laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased from 33.6% to 17.6% post partum; subsequent readings at 27 weeks showed 29.1% and at 34 weeks 34.3%

laboratory_examinations.findings: 10.1 g/dL (reference range for nonpregnant women: 12.0 to 16.0)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Postpartum hemoglobin was 9.3 g/dL on postoperative day 1; increased to 10.3 g/dL on postoperative day 8 and to 11.4 g/dL on postoperative day 20

laboratory_examinations.findings: Ferritin: 66 ng/mL, Iron: 89 μg/dL, Total iron-binding capacity: 273 μg/dL (all within normal range)
Suggestive of placenta accreta (right lateral complete placenta previa, large echolucencies in the placenta)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: High risk of placenta accreta increased from 40% to more than 60% after initial ultrasound at 20 weeks

laboratory_examinations.findings: Complete placenta previa confirmed with signs of placenta accreta
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Previously noted signs of accreta were unequivocal; prior ultrasound indicated additional evaluation was unnecessary
